net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Class TextArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.TextArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Component>, LocaleContextSource, Component, Editable, ListCellRenderer, TableCellEditor, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellEditor, TreeCellRenderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalizedObjectKeyTextAreaComponent

    public class TextArea
extends ComponentImpl
implements Editable, TableCellRenderer, TableCellEditor, TreeCellRenderer, TreeCellEditor, ListCellRenderer

    Simple TextArea.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

    • Method Detail

      • addActionListener

        public void addActionListener(ActionListener listener)
        Add an ActionListener to get ActionEvent objects when "Enter" is pressed (or some other medium defined gesture) while this TextArea has focus. The gesture is medium dependent and therefore may not be consistent across mediums. For example, some mediums may not fire an ActionEvent object for a multiline TextArea.
        Parameters:
        listener - The ActionListener

      • appendText

        Parameters:
        s - the text to append.

      • getHTMLElement

        public Element getHTMLElement()
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Get the top level elements this component will output in its current state. This should not included the entire content model.

        For example, if your code outputs the following, <p><span><b></b></span></p>, then you should only return one element that is a "p"; NOT "p, span, b".

        All configuration elements should be nested within this top element, or other arrangements should be made with the inner keeper.

        Specified by:
        getHTMLElement in interface Component
        Returns:
        the element.

      • getListCellRendererComponent

        public Component getListCellRendererComponent(ListModelComponent list,
                                              java.lang.Object value,
                                              boolean isSelected,
                                              boolean hasFocus,
                                              int row)
        Description copied from interface: ListCellRenderer
        Returns a Component to use for rendering a cell in a ListModelComponent.
        Specified by:
        getListCellRendererComponent in interface ListCellRenderer
        Parameters:
        list - The ListModelComponent that has the data being rendered.
        value - The value of the cell being rendered.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        hasFocus - Indicates if the cell has focus, implementations may want to indicate this in the UI.
        row - The row for the cell.
        Returns:
        A Component which can be used to display the value stored in the specified list cell.

        Returns:

      • getTableCellEditorComponent

        public Component getTableCellEditorComponent(Table table,
                                             java.lang.Object value,
                                             boolean isSelected,
                                             int row,
                                             int column)
        Description copied from interface: TableCellEditor

        Returns a Component to use for editing a cell in a table.

        Note to implementers of this interface: If you write a class that implements this interface and returns another TableCellEditor capable Component, be sure to call the other Component's getTableCellEditorComponent() method.

        Specified by:
        getTableCellEditorComponent in interface TableCellEditor
        Parameters:
        table - The Table that has the data being edited.
        value - The value of the cell being edited.
        isSelected - Indicates whether the cell is in a selected state.
        row - The row for the cell.
        column - The column model index (NOT the model index!).
        Returns:
        An object that is a Component which can be used to edit the value stored in the specified table cell.

      • preRenderProcess

        public void preRenderProcess(Request request,
                             Response response,
                             RendererEditorState<?> rendererEditorState)
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Allow the component to process any form fields before rendering. This method must be called by subclasses. Method calls on components, creating or destroying components, or nearly everything else having to do with the component tree and related data models must be done by queuing an event using EventQueue.queue(EventQueueElement). Otherwise you may get unexpected results.
        Specified by:
        preRenderProcess in interface Component
        Overrides:
        preRenderProcess in class ComponentImpl
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        rendererEditorState - the renderer / editor state, will be null if not using as a renderer / editor.

      • unWatchIncremental

        public TextArea unWatchIncremental()
        Stop watching for changes.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        watchIncremental()

      • watch

        public TextArea watch()
        Watch this component for changes and send an update via AJAX.

        If you add an ActionListener to this component, AJAX updates will also occur view via AJAX when the user presses enter.

        Returns:
        this.

      • watchIncremental

        public TextArea watchIncremental()
        Watch this component for changes as the user types and send an update via AJAX. This will produce more frequent events to the server than watch(). Do not use if the processing of events may be time consuming or resource intensive. Also, if this TextArea component will be invalidated and re-rendered as a result of processing, use watch() instead.

        If you add an ActionListener to this component, AJAX updates will also occur view via AJAX when the user presses enter.

        Returns:
        this.
